column1: Kata Robata////I've tried almost all of their special makis too. The best one is the Texas Hamachi with yellowtail
column3: eel and tempura shrimp. If you don't like spicy rolls
column4: then the longhorn and the rising sun are also pretty good. Pretty much all of the sushi here is good. I've been to a bunch of sushi restaurants where the rice falls apart or the fish is cut too thick. At Kata they have good quality control so neither of those happen.
